answers.answer: You need a yearly eye examination by an ophthalmologist. Perhaps you already have one. Discuss this next examination. Most often its not anything serious.JCH III MD

question: I've had significant red splotches on the white of my left eyeball three times in as many months.I do not have high blood pressure (actually, mine is about 100 over 60), and I do not have diabetes.I have blood work every few months to monitor cholesterol and hypothyroidism.  At this time I am not taking any cholesterol-lowering medicine; however, I do take a very small dose (.075mg) of Levothyroxine daily.I am a 68 year old woman.  I had prosthetic lenses for cataracts in 1998.
title: subconjunctival hemmorhage
